clinical_study.brief_title: Prospective, Multicenter Study of the Second Generation Antimicrobial Graft in the Abdominal Position
clinical_study.official_title: Multicenter Clinical Study Assessing the Performance and the Safety of the Second Generation Antimicrobial Graft in the Abdominal Position

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this prospective trial is to demonstrate the safety and performance of the Second Generation Anti-Microbial vascular graft in the treatment of aneurysmal and occlusive diseases of the abdominal aorta.

clinical_study.condition: Aneurysmal Disease of the Abdominal Aorta
Occlusive Disease of the Abdominal Aorta

arm_group.description: Consecutive patients meeting the selection criteria

intervention.intervention_name: Second Generation Anti-Microbial bifurcated vascular graft (InterGard)
intervention.description: treatment of patients with aorto-iliac occlusion,stenosis, or aneurysm

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Is 18 - 85 years of age
- Is presenting with an aorto-iliac occlusion (obstruction of flow) or stenosis, or aorto-iliac aneurysm and is eligible for a revascularization with a bifurcated graft
- Is affiliated with a social welfare organization system
- Is willing to participate in the clinical evaluation after signature of the informed consent
- Is able to attend all follow up visits and diagnostics and laboratory exams required by the present protocol
Exclusion Criteria:
- Is treated as an emergency
- Is included in another investigation
- Is pregnant or lactating, or a woman of childbearing potential unwillint to use an effective form of contraception for the duration of the trial
- Has a known allergy to the material device used
- Has previous aorto-iliac bypass or replacement
